pageContext.claim: “Before we close the border, we'll put the tariffs on the cars. I don't think we'll ever have to close the border because the penalty of tariffs on cars coming into the United States from Mexico at 25 percent will be massive.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump negotiated a new trade deal to revise parts of NAFTA. That deal, the USMCA, has not been ratified by Congress and is not in effect. But the Trump administration, in a side letter to the USMCA, agreed to exempt Mexico from a wide range of auto industry tariffs. The side letter is already in effect, although the larger USMCA is not.
